result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael John Ellis

defendant.name: Ellis, Michael John
defendant.address: 631 N Michigan, Prairie Du Chien, WI 53821

records.addlTxt:
3:22 PM  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Michael John Ellis not in court. 

Atty. Steiner requests a warrant be issued and that he be held for further hearing

Court authorizes a warrant - Def. to be held for a bond hearing

3:10 PM Case called - appearances stated. 
Defendant Michael John Ellis in court.  Attorney Luke Steiner in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Def. states he is eligible for Public Defender, believes Atty. Erickson will be appointed.
Court will continue
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 18, 2022 at 03:15 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on October 18, 2022 at 03:15 pm.

9:45 AM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Michael John Ellis in court.  Attorney Luke Steiner in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Court informs defendant of nature of charges and penalty sections of criminal complaint for each count.  Defendant states understanding.  Right to counsel is explained.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 4, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on October 4, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

9:12 AM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Michael J Ellis in court.  Attorney Luke Steiner in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Erickson appears in court for Defendant Michael J Ellis. 

State is heard, continue this case to another date.
Hearing scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 09:45 am.

3:22 PM Case called - appearances stated. 
Defendant Michael J Ellis appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Court finds probable cause - will address bond
Atty. Steiner is heard on issue of bond - requests $1000.00 cash with conditions that Defendant is not to possess or consume controlled substances except those specifically prescribed to the defendant. Defendant is to submit to random urinalysis at the request of law enforcement and if results are positive or defendant refuses, defendant shall submit to blood draw. 
Def. has 3 other cases set for plea/sentencing on Sept. 16, 2022 has several failure to appears, significant amount of cash necessary to secure his appearance and assure compliance with conditions.

Defendant is heard on issue of bond - significant amount of time since he has missed a court date - has no ability to pay $1000.00. Requests signature bond

Court orders $250.00 cash bond with conditions -  Defendant is not to possess or consume controlled substances except those specifically prescribed to the defendant. Defendant is to submit to random urinalysis at the request of law enforcement and if results are positive or defendant refuses, defendant shall submit to blood draw. 

Right to counsel explained to defendant - advises def. to contact Public defender ASAP to see if  Atty. Erickson can be appointed to this case also (as well as 3 other cases he already has)
Hearing scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 09:00 am.
